text: Margaret Clark Gillett (1878-1962) was a British botanist and social reformer who is noted for advocating for women and children held in concentration camps following the Boer War. In February 1909 she married banker Arthur Bevington Gillett (1875-1954). ==References== Category:1878 births Category:1962 deaths Category:Women botanists Category:Boer Wars Category:British suffragists Category:British women scientists
title: Margaret Clark Gillett
